meanings.definition: (of a liquid) to flow or pass slowly through small openings or spaces
meanings.sent1: The water seeped into the cracks of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the water seeped through the roof of the old house.
meanings.sent3: The tea seeped so slowly that it felt like a turtle race.
meanings.sent4: The sadness seeped into her heart like ink on a paper.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread seeped through the bakery, tempting everyone passing by.

meanings.definition: (of a quality or emotion) to gradually spread or penetrate
meanings.sent1: His kindness seeped into every interaction he had with others.
meanings.sent2: As time passed, a sense of peace seeped into her troubled mind.
meanings.sent3: Laughter seeped out of the comedy show, infecting the whole audience.
meanings.sent4: The excitement seeped through the crowd like electricity.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun seeped into her skin, making her feel alive.

meanings.definition: (past tense) to have oozed or leaked out gradually
meanings.sent1: The oil seeped out of the engine, causing a mess.
meanings.sent2: The scent of flowers seeped from the perfume bottle she dropped.
meanings.sent3: The secret she kept seeped out during the game of charades.
meanings.sent4: The memories seeped back into his mind, flooding him with nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The color slowly seeped out of the painting, leaving it dull and lifeless.
